item.description:
Take a step back in time at the Renaissance Faire...
Enjoy some shows or shop for unique gifts. Feast and be merry. Cheer on your favorite knight in the joust. http://www.ctfaire.com/index.php Check out the site for more details but as a renfaire goer, I assure you, they are fun especially if you dress up in the garb :) 

The CT faire runs for the next few weekends from 11am-6pm and Fall seems to be filling up fast for us all, so I am listing the themed weekends coming up so we can take a vote on which date we should go. I know we want to have many options for meetups, but we can't always pull off being in 2 places at once (well, I know I haven't mastered that skill yet!) If you choose a date I can't make, I just ask for a volunteer to host.

Saturday October 1: Vow renewal day (Romance anyone?)
Sunday October 2: Babes in Bodices Contest (for the guys) & Highland games (so muscular men in kilts for the ladies)
Saturday October 8: Halloween Knights with costume contests, scary ghouls and zombies and um... barbarian invasion too.
Sunday October 9: Pirate invasion
Saturday October 15: Children's Fantacy/Masquerade/Pet weekend with Halloween Knights
Sunday October 16: Pet weekend (Really - you can bring your pet)

Admission is $16.00 which you can buy online (for a small fee) or at the gate (no credit cards at the gate) I would suggest bringing cash for food - some vendors accept credit cards. Parking is $3 so we should plan carpool meetup locations as well. The shows and entertainment are free but there may be additional activities available for an extra cost.

They have sample itineraries on the website or we can just wing it (haha - get it? really , it's my last one)
item.name: Connecticut Renaissance Faire
